First time in this newly opened Ross by my house and it's a huge store with lots of merchandise. Unfortunately for my 6"5, 250lb size my options are usually limited they were out of 13 size shoes that match my style and pants and shirts are limited. <user>106679123883773832975< /user>< user_name>
Gene Ever</user_name>
<Date>1603771175964<//Date>< Rating>
5< /Rating>
< text>
I kept passing by this quaint, little store. It's neat downtown Vallejo and I didn't think much of it, but I told myself I'd walk in there one day to at least figure out what kind of dresses I would like. Then, I'd order online and be on my way. I was mistaken. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and immediately helped. Miss Maria was like my fairy godmother of dresses. She has such a good eye on what's going to fit. Personally, when I saw all the dresses on hangers, I couldn't see the difference. Miss Maria brought out dresses she thought I would like or dresses that would look good on me. And guuurl... Was she right! I ended up buying a dress I never knew I wanted. I used to hate the idea of mermaid dresses or anything other than white. I didn't know that there was so much more to dresses than just the style... There's the waistline and the bodice and the lace, and the weight. She helped me even when I kept going back and forth. She was so nice and easy to talk to and like I said... AMAZING EYE when it comes to style and fit. I bought a wedding dress that same day (on my birthday.) I finally didn't even care to look at the price (the dresses I looked at where from $700 to $1500). I found my dream dress and I adore miss Maria! Support local businesses! Don't bother shopping online, I promise you, it's a better feeling actually going in person and getting one on one help and fittings.<//text>

<gmap_id>0x80c2c7c7dec4a3df:0x89c6bfb5f12e3795<//gmap_id><review>After 2 weeks of stress and anxiety as I searched far and wide for my next home, I came to tour a few units at H+F via their newly established self-guided walkthrough. I was greeted by an incredibly friendly staff in an absolutely beautiful lobby. The lobby was adorned with luxurious mid-century modern furniture and featured a collection of designer coffee table books. I felt like I was at a brand new 5 Star hotel. I toured the units on the 15th floor which contain all of the models. I was amazed. No expenses were spared. High-end fixtures, Nest thermostats, flush/color matched fridges and dishwashers. Amazing.

What really blew me away are the amenities. 3 rooftop pools/jacuzzis, 3 sauna/steam rooms, gym, music room, co-working space, multiple sky lounges, game room, library, chefs kitchen, dog park oh my! For God‚Äôs sake, they put a window in the sauna on the 44th floor‚Ä¶.who does that? Incredible design and execution.

The thing that sold me on signing a lease at H+F was the staff. We‚Äôre in uncertain times right now and living in a place where I feel safe is of the upmost importance. Everyone on security, maintenance, management and leasing teams are professional and on it. Compared with the other properties I toured across LA, H+F seemed have the best practices in place for health/safety measures surrounding COVID.

Finally I want to give some recognition to the leasing manager who assisted me every step of the way, Alexandria. She was incredibly helpful through the entire process. I‚Äôm someone who has a tendency to ask an obnoxious amount of questions and she never showed even a sliver of impatience. She was charming, sweet, professional and welcomed all of my questions and flags with direct, honest answers. She was genuine & I never felt that she recited something she pulled from an employee handbook. Her follow ups went above and beyond - she personally took videos to send to me of specific units I was interested in. The icing on the cake was that she advised me on some issues I was having with my previous complex.

I‚Äôm home.

TL/DR: Feel free to message me if you have any questions regarding H+F.< /review>< user_id>

< Review>
I moved here from circa back in September and it was the biggest mistake I ever made. Once you move in you will not get a response from management about anything. I had an expensive package that magically disappeared from concierge (they signed it in and out) they then tried to say it was never received, once I provided proof of delivery and signature, they said they would get back to me. This was in October and I still have not heard anything back. I have called over 10 times and emailed management. Still no response.

The apartment itself looks nice at first but once you move in it is so cheaply done. Every week something else breaks. The property is also not well kept, there have been stains in the hallway for months and garbage stacked up right outside elevators. This place is so far from a luxury building.

You will be overcharged for utilities and get no explanation about that either. I have lived in a house twice the size of my apartment and my utilities bills were not even close to the price here. Makes absolutely no sense at all.

Concierge is extremely rude and unprofessional. Every guest I have had over has asked why the concierge had so much attitude.

I'm counting the days for my lease to be up so I can move out of this place. I used to love coming home when I lived at circa and since living at Hope and flower I really hate coming home.I<//Review>

<review>7 months strong! Now with the Equinox sized gym open (with restrictions), it's truly like living full time at a Ritz Carlton.
The place has really started filling up and the people coming in are great. I do think the secret is out. The amenities, the prices, the luxury here... there's no way there's going to be availability for much longer. It'll be a full building soon. Beyond the actual building, the people here really, really care about their jobs. You'll get to know everybody by their names, and they know you by yours. Michael, who has over the months given me such a massive sense of comfort in knowing that on his watch, not a thing is going to slip, calls something out when it needs fixed. He isn't afraid to be the person he needs to be to protect the community. Very important through the pandemic to have a leader on the team such as him. I literally don't think I've ever seen somebody so caring with what they do as him. I would love to have him as my own employee. I am not lying when I say that some mornings when I walk out the apartment feeling a little unmotivated, seeing him day and night busting into gear lifts me up.
The Property Manager James is empathetic, human, and while clearly responsible for leading one of the biggest properties in LA at the executive level very well, also makes enough time to have 1:1 relationships with every single resident here. It's like having a great friend as your landlord, not like having somebody you have to go through corporate layering to chat about new ideas or issues with to find.

< review>
Overall this building delivers on its promise as a fairly well run, higher-end apartment community in South Park. I have lived here for several months and in particular find the concierge staff friendly and helpful. My only concern living here is the amount of people who do not wear masks in common areas (elevators are particularly problematic) which goes unenforced. The community tends to attract a pretty young demographic that isn‚Äôt too concerned with maintaining a healthy environment for others. The towers are quite new which means you can expect common issues including accidental fire alarms and maintenance requests to fix newly discovered issues as the management company learns how to operate successfully. If you‚Äôre stuck in decision paralysis between a handful of almost identical apartment options in DTLA at similar price points, you‚Äôll probably be just fine choosing to live here.<//review>

<Pics>None</Pics>< userid>
115936861841849924671</userid>
<text>We moved to Hope and Flower 1 year ago, god time has flown by. The building amenities are absolutely some of the best in DTLA and South Park area. The units are well equipped with some of the best appliances we have had in an apartment home. The oven is great and so is the stove. Being huge cooks, we loved our appliances and will be missing them dearly when moving out.

The property has 3 pools with different views and levels of sun exposure (sometimes you are not looking to burn and just want to chill). All hot tubs are oversized and HOT, which is great to have a drink in the afternoon after working all day, super relaxing. We loved the amount of common rooms at the property too, tons of space to move around and not be on top of your neighbors. There is grills on the 8th floor and also the rooftops.

The building management is attentive, even during covid. The front desk does enforce wearing a mask on property and walking through the lobby (Which is great! They are trying to save lives, remember to mask up). Maintenance is quick when you place a work order; for the building or even your apartment home. I will say, they are very covid safe with masks, gloves and shoe covers. It is much appreciated as we are concerned over covid safety.

The neighborhood is still seeing development, even during these trying times. Most restaurants are still open for take out and the neighborhood is generally safe to walk around. We have not had any issues since we have lived here. Once this pandemic lifts the area will be booming again and I can see restaurants flooding back-in as concert goers and sporting games will bring in crowds (remember when you could go to a bar and drink??). They are building a CVS on the corner, which is great for convenience and also there is a local high end market 1 block away on Grand Ave. . There are 2 breweries in the neighborhood, if that is your thing. 3 grocery stores with in walking distance or very quick car ride. The train is right underneath the building, if you rely on that to get to work. Also there is 7th&fig and "the bloc" not to far away as well (about a 15 min walk).

As we are preparing to move out we will be missing the staff here at Hope and Flower and also the DTLA area. There is still so much to do here even during the pandemic (farmers market, Pershing square park and etc.). We will be truly missing our apartment home here and also all things to take advantage of here in town. The area is central to everything (25 mins to pretty much all of what LA has to offer). Unfortunately, due to relocation for work we will have be leaving H+F and DTLA. If we are ever back, we will 100% consider this as our home again.< /text>< gmap_id>
0x80c2c7c7dec4a3df:0x89c6bfb5f12e3795</gmap_id>

< Review>
I recently moved from across the country (Georgia) in hopes of finding a great residence in a great area of downtown Los Angeles. I have been severely disappointed in my stay at the Hope + Flower apartments.

The customer service has been the exact opposite of the ‚ÄòSouthern Hospitality‚Äù that I am used to. I pay over $5,000 a month for what is SUPPOSED to be a luxury residence and I regret the decision I have made as well as many other residents who have informed me of their complaints regarding plumbing/ maintenance , elevator issues, and concierge/guest services.

I have received complaints from my personal guest explaining to me how they have been given condescending looks as they enter the building and how they have been profiled by concierge and received disrespectful and personal remarks such as, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre always here so I know you don‚Äôt work. So, where is all this money and clothes coming from?‚Äù.

Personally, I have noticed concierge shaking their head as I walk in and out with my guest which makes me and my guest uncomfortable to the point where I sometimes exit through the side doors to keep myself from having to encounter the unsteadiness I get from walking through my own lobby. I have also had to block certain employees of the building because they share my social media pages with each other and make remarks about that as well when I walk by and I feel it is a huge invasion of my privacy.

I feel taken advantage of because I signed my lease and was promised certain move in specials that were not given when I moved in. I even contacted Yen in management to receive the extra concessions that I was promised and she said they would fix it. I have been at this residence for almost 2 months and I still have no parking spot and I have still not received close to $1,000 which was promised in my particular move in deal.

One of the biggest problems is that my fob to use the amenities has not been working for quite some time. Today I spoke to someone from the management team and they informed me that my individual unit has been RESTRICTED from using any of the amenities that I pay $5,000 a month for. Without even informing me they have basically put me on timeout as if I were a little kid in kindergarten and THIS issue needs to be fixed TODAY!

This has been the WORST living experience I have ever had! I have spoken to 10+ residents who agree and are ready to pack their bags and put this building and terrible experience behind us. The disrespect, belittlement, unprofessionalism, will not be tolerated from such a profitable building like this.</Review>

<user>104961720737239364953</user><time>1601675657205< /time>< text>
Do not move to this building. Management is irresponsible, amateur, and unresponsive. It's not worth the price nor the hustle. Here is why:

(Irresponsible management)
- It usually takes weeks for mgmt to respond if you are lucky, 75% of the time, mgmt doest not respond to email inquiries
- The main garage gate is broken and wide open, and it usually takes weeks to get fixed. As a result, multiple cars have been burglarized
- Service orders could take months to be fixed, e.g., cleaning windows, fixing failing breakers

(Lack of transparency(Costs & Communications))
- When asking about utility costs before moving in, we got one story. As the first few months went by, new costs line items were added and disproportionally increased. You pretty much pay for everything in this building on top of rent and through the shady utility bill. This is well documented if you read other yelp reviews from the sister property 825 S Hill or even within this post
- When something happens in the building, like criminal activity or emergencies, mgmt is never transparent about events but rather cryptic. - Residents often need to talk among themselves through private groups to get an idea about what's happening or has happened

(COVID Remedies & Measures)
- After multiple requests for concessions, mgmt has not given any credits/concessions in regards to the lack of access to amenities that we are paying for
- As a result of the actions of a few irresponsible residents, mgmt decided to shut down access for all residents and several days to one of the rooftops
- Mgmt charges full prices for utilities associated with amenities that, for most of the pandemic, have been unavailable</text>

<Rate>1</Rate><text>I'm giving this building a one star because of my overall experience living here. As a person who's been a business owner for over 8 years, I can assure you that this management staff has no official training or experience with customer service. The building itself is beautiful, amazing sky views and gorgeous amenities that will leave your breath taken but will also leave you blinded by the truth behind their poor business operations. DO NOT MOVE HERE if you are looking for quality. This building was poorly built and has very cheap finishes. The kitchen back splash stains easily around where the fire burns, which makes it impossible to clean, the cabinets are from ikea, small finishes in the bathroom were not put together, wooden floors in the bedroom are lifting up and I hadn't even been here for a full 2 months before all that started happening. I've only seen someone clean the hallways maybe 3 times since living here. (Whereas my old luxury building had the hallways cleaned daily) it makes it really hard to avoid seeing and smelling dog feces throughout the building. The windows are not soundproof, and the walls are paper thin so you can hear and smell everything around you. If you're a person that is sensitive to smells or works from home you will not like it here at all. In addition, we are not able to use amenities at all and are still paying for them. Even with all that I just mentioned it still wasn't enough for me to rate this place a one star until I started getting harassed by security.

I would say I had a security guard at my door at least 30 times in a 5 month time span because of ONE PERSON‚ÄôS SMOKE COMPLAINT!!! I do not smoke, so I started to feel harassed and unsafe in my own home. I have a weird neighbor who's genuinely blaming me for something I‚Äôm not doing and management never came to see for themselves but continued to put lease violations on my door while I was out of town taking care of my sick family. On top of it all there were 2 different nights I was on my balcony and a security guard leaned over and peeked into my balcony from the neighbors balcony. I felt completely violated. Management has done nothing about this issue and I continue to feel unsafe and anxious in this place. I feel as though the fate of my living stability is at the hands of someone else who and I developed a huge anxiety over it and I honestly have a fear of even being at home.

I was told that a person who works for the property periodically goes on to vacant balconies to take pictures of tenants for various reasons. I was also told that the management company has started doing short term leases / Airbnb type of rentals since the corona virus has started which none of the tenants were aware of upon signing our leases. There have been several gunshots and drug busts reported in the building since they have started the air bnb rentals, and we have no choice but to live amongst people who have not been background checked. Management does not inform you of any of what is happening, besides rent reminders and cutting off amenities to paying tenants!

H+F‚Äôs  customer service is VERY poor. The concierge staff is very rude and has been rude to me as well as my guests. They have racially profiled my guests and have left my guests outside refusing to let them in on several occasions. I have a work partner who will not come to visit me anymore because of how poorly they were treated multiple times. Karen the front desk manager has yelled at me and has been rude to my family members as well.

Management is the absolute worst, which is why the teams below them are also awful. I moved here expecting that I am paying for quality and I received the opposite. I will not take the stress they have put me through lightly AT ALL! DO NOT MOVE HERE if you want to live in a stress free environment, living here feels like you are being put through hell  there's a reason why there's many many horrible reviews, we can‚Äôt all be lying here. I know 30+ Tenants who have similar experiences and just as unhappy. Imagine how many more there are!<//text>< Pics>

<Text>Updated review:
I gave this place 5 stars and referred many friends, even when issues came up I gave them the benefit of the doubt because I had a relationship with the management. I even was convincing my own family to get one of the sky homes. However what led me to write this review is when the head manager of this building lied straight to my face and lost all credibility. The manager destroyed my trust in this place and I'm disturbed.

Many 5 star reviews have been incentivized and some from real estate brokers who also gets a commission. (If you care about where you are going to live then read all the bad reviews so you get the full picture)

The utilities are much higher than others, I pay about $250 per month just on utilities and I am a single occupant. They give verbal concessions case by case but rarely executes it. My car in my own assigned parking space was towed after 2 months  (common occurrence). Yes, I repeat, it was towed from my assigned space after head manager emailed they won't touch the vehicle until they sorted out their own mess, but the same manager facilitated the towing company right after to tow it. They often double book the same parking space because they don't have an effective system in place to track parking.

Management mishandles your personal information and looses/destroys paperwork that has your signature on it. I found many issues on my paperwork (wrong date, different rent price from what is quoted)

Pro: amenities (closed) + (views on some units, not all)
Con: (read if you care about your security deposit) floors are sensitive to stains, scratches - bathroom sink is tiny - balcony is going to get very dusty, floors 1-7 you can hear the parking lot noises.

The entry way for some units are zig zag or narrow so if you have normal sized furniture you might have trouble fitting them in. Some of the floors are known to smell like weed so check the floor you will be moving into. The balconies are very close to each other so you will hear your neighbors or smell their food that they are cooking. Toilets do not flush properly and when I return home the toilet closest to the door has an odor that is terrible - a health hazard and residents often get pink eye.

The front desk concierge staff is nosy and hostile, and will try to enter your unit during maintenance appointments to inspect your space. They ask intrusive questions. They don't respect your privacy and leaks personal information.  The residential administrators B and L are great people but they don't have much power over what the building owners or managers decide on.

As a social person, I have many friends who visit me and they have time and time again complained how rude the front desk concierge was. I feel so embarrassed and have bought $70 worth of gourmet donuts, provided masks to the staff to create a more friendly environment but my efforts can't cover management's mistakes and lack of service.

They also watch your guests and document everything in a log which I'll leave it to you to have your own opinion on that.

I'm torn because I loved this building and management's lack of proper handling and thorough follow through is making it unbearable, unhealthy, and hostile to live in.

Tips:
I recommend Jenna at the leasing office.
Msg me to get more details. @geummy

When touring -
Take notice of closet space and the bathrooms (some has standing showers vs bathtub) also notice the entry way as some are wide and some are like a maze (if it's narrow moving large furniture might be challenging)
Their dishwasher doesn't try thoroughly and make sure you don't get a defected one so test it when you move in.

For great lighting I recommend south facing and for diffused light: East facing<//Text></record></dataset><record>

<Text>What‚Äôs not to love? Beautiful apartments, great amenities, and top notch customer service. My leasing consultant, Kate, went above and beyond for me.< /Text><username>Izabela Kaczor< /username></record>

101494125106583961246<//user_id>
<Name>Richard Golding</Name>< time>
1587672243761</time>
< rate>
5<//rate>
< review>
I can't say enough about this building.  This building is by far ahead of its class in regards to DTLA apartments.  The amenities are incredible.  3 saunas, 3 steam rooms, 3 pools, a gym better than most Equinox's, and a game room.  Not to mention office space, music room, and chefs kitchen.
The apartments are well equipped with luxury appliances with the refrigerator and dishwasher being hidden as cabinets.  Living here I'll tell you the views are great.  And a reviewer mentioned train noise.  If you live on that side of the building it isn't enough to be a deal breaker with all that you're getting.  I'd mention the welcome kit you receive when you move in but I'll leave that as a good surprise for you.

My leasing agent Jeanna was incredible.  Her professionalism and level of service is second to none.  She walked me through the entire leasing process.  But what I found incredible was that she even gave me measurements to the apartment. This was very helpful for furniture shopping. Bryan and Lisa in resident services couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating in assisting me with my move in.  I moved in during the shutdown so I really appreciated them taking care of my needs and checking up on me to see if I was ok.  The concierge's and rest of the staff have been great.

If you're looking to move DTLA or relocate from your current building this is where you need to be.</review>

<userid>112345160657629381249</userid>< Name>
Kym Vanden Elzen<//Name>
< Date>
1580580990631<//Date>
< Rating>
1< /Rating>
< Text>
I put a deposit down on a unit facing the West side of the flower tower.
After going to take a second look It was quite obvious that the Tram noise was going to be an issue. Jenna, the leasing agent seemed a bit pushy saying " oh well thats city living". Traffic noise is one thing and not an issue. However the timed Tram bell, horn, and announcements I think would drive one crazy unless you are a "dead to the world sleeper".

I went back again looked at a few more units. The North facing units (hope and flower tower) the Tram runs on the left side of you. I could also hear it with the doors and windows shut. I then went back a fourth time and picked a south facing unit. However, upon  leaving I could see and hear the Tram to the Right of me. You may be able to escape the tram noise from the East facing units?

The amenities are very nice and look fabulous. I think they spent more money on amenities and skimped on the actual units. Keep in mind the bathroom vanity is tiny, half size fridge and stove. It looks good but not sure how functional it would be. Also the last unit I decided on had uneven flooring in the bedroom. Note there is no sound proofing between walls. The only thing separating you from your neighbor is simply dry wall with no insulation in-between.

Other concerns about Hope and Flower is that they will also implement a 46.00 charge per month for the electricity in the common areas. This is in addition to your utilities in your apartment. This has just started at their sister property 825 South Hill.

Onni Group also currently utilizes part of their building in Chicago Old Town Park I and II short term rentals ( weekends). Just like their Level Hotel. This could also be a potential problem for Hope and Flower.

I must say everyone there was super friendly and Helpful.
Kate was super helpful and knowledgeable , as well as Jose, Chase, and Karen.

I lost my $500.00 deposit, But escaped 26 months of what would have been sleepless nights because of the Tram.< /Text>

< rating>
5</rating>
< Review>
I have had the privilege to work with Jeana Davidson and Hudson for many years now (about 10 year).  We are a small community of homes (about 15 homes in Danville, CA) with fewer needs than likely most other home owner associations.  And as such, we probably would not be high on the priority list for most management companies.  But I have never felt that way with Jeana and Hudson.  They have always very responsive and professional, making it a point to try to keep up on point with a lot of deadlines, and kept us in the loop with any third parties we had to deal with.  I've always been impressed with the ability of Jeana and Hudson to make us a priority, and have enjoyed working with them.</Review>

<review>Hudson does NOT negotiate with any vendors, and we have overpaid 100% to 300% for many condo services.

One example:
Current Electric (a preferred Hudson vendor) of Concord charged us $120 each for 181 outdoor lights or $30K total!
Current Electric bought each light for $30 each at an online distributor for $6k total.  All Current Electric did was print out a one-page spec sheet on the distributor web site, and then, hid the Distributor name and web info at the top.  Nobody at Hudson even called to fight the overcharge.< /review>< date>
1616444146548</date>

< Text>
I have lived in the Bay Area my whole life and of all the comparable HOA Management companies they seem to have the most presentable and professional service of all. I was recommended by a fellow coworker who uses them, and was impressed. Of the places around they have lower fees, but they are NOT a big time company. They have a small feel, making them more personable. I had a problem with a roof leak, and instead of a phone call they met with me in person to discuss the options. If you are looking for a personable HOA Management company this is the place. But, if you are looking to overpay and receive spotty customer service go elsewhere.< /Text>

< Text>
I have had the privilege to work with Jeana Davidson and Hudson for many years now (about 10 year).  We are a small community of homes (about 15 homes in Danville, CA) with fewer needs than likely most other home owner associations. <rate>4< /rate><Review>I have lived in the Bay Area my whole life and of all the comparable HOA Management companies they seem to have the most presentable and professional service of all. I was recommended by a fellow coworker who uses them, and was impressed. Of the places around they have lower fees, but they are NOT a big time company. They have a small feel, making them more personable. I had a problem with a roof leak, and instead of a phone call they met with me in person to discuss the options. If you are looking for a personable HOA Management company this is the place. But, if you are looking to overpay and receive spotty customer service go elsewhere.< /Review>< Pictures>

< time>
1604419126984<//time>
<Rating>2< /Rating>< text>
Unclear vehicle histories...  We went to the Ontario location to look at a car that was a good price compared to other similar models in the area.  Online, the car was advertised as having no reported accidents.  The salesman told us several times that none of the cars on their lots have any accident history,  Ok...  sounds good.  When they finally located the car, we looked it over.   The front bumper had evidence of being repainted and most of the inner fender clips were missing on the front driver's side of the car.  The inner fender liner looked very clear like it was new but it was sagging down due to the missing clips.  It was obvious that the front bumper had been removed and repainted yet Carfax showed now accident history.  Maybe the previous owner fixed the bumper in their garage...  who knows.  We didn't want to buy a car with some unknown repairs.

So...  we looked at the second car that was also listed as having no accident history.  The car looked OK from a distance.  When opening the passenger side doors there was signs of a repaint with overspray on the black door moldings.  Looking closer you could see where the car had been taped off for a repaint.  The was evidence of the entire right side of the car being repainted and part of the trunk.  That's a lot of paint work for a car with no 'reported accidents'

2 out of 2 cars we looked at had evidence of body repairs.  They said they get the cars at auction.  Do they come from the 'scratch and dent' auction??

The staff was helpful so I give them a 2 overall but would not buy any car from them based on the repairs we saw on this visit.< /text>

Everything was good with the car, so we bought it and had financing through our credit union.  STG confirmed the credit union would pay them, so we signed the papers and took the car. I won‚Äôt be able to pick up the car before the service department closes so he tells me that he will leave the keys at the front desk for me. As I‚Äôm picking up the car, a guy that I‚Äôm guessing works in the service center acknowledges me and says (as if to get me excited) ‚Äúoh you‚Äôre basically getting a new engine, the new one only has 5,000 miles on it!‚Äù I just say, ok cool and try to get on my way. I‚Äôm not mad that the engine has 5,000 miles on it, I just don‚Äôt understand why Andrew told me it would be brand new.

As I‚Äôm driving home from FINALLY getting my new car, 4 weeks after purchasing it, the air conditioner isn‚Äôt working. It worked when I test drove it, so I knew this was a new issue. My brother looked at it and determined that they didn‚Äôt replace the freon. I truthfully wanted to be done with STG at this point, so I decided to take my car somewhere else where it costs $150 to have the Freon put in the car.

Once that was fixed, I thought it was time to start enjoying my new car and move on from this whole situation. This was until I noticed fluid that leaked from my car onto my driveway. This is 4 days after I picked up the car, after they replaced the engine. As much as I didn‚Äôt want to come back to STG, I thought it was transmission fluid leaking so I called them to take a look at it. Turns out it was just coolant and luckily it was an easy fix and they took care of it right away. As I was driving away from the dealership I noticed the check engine light was now on. I HAD TO TURN AROUND AND GO BACK. The situation is just beyond hilarious to me at this point.

I really hope this is the last issue with this vehicle. Overall, the service department did make me feel like I was a priority to them, and I think they tried their best. It‚Äôs unfortunate that they had to be in the middle of this situation, but none of this ever should have happened. They should not have sold me this car. And what REALLY upsets me even further is that Michael, or even one of his superiors, never reached out to me to make sure that I was being taken care of. I work in customer service and I really would have thought that someone would have made the effort to reach out and acknowledge in some way that they made a huge mistake.

I will never return to STG as a customer, nor will I recommend them to anyone I know.</review>< pics>

< review>
I saw a car online and called to see if it was still available and they said yes. I was told to hurry up and come on down and give it a test drive.  This was at about 9am.  I said I would come around noon and they said the car would be pulled out front and waiting for me.  This sounded great and I was looking forward to checking it out.

When I arrived the car wasn't there and I ended up waiting for about 15 minutes before the salesman came to greet me.  This is where it really went sideways - I got bored waiting in the lobby so I decided to go walk the lot.  As I exited the salesman was outside talking to an employee and after we made eye contact he let me have the bad news.  Apparently the car arrived on the lot the night before and was now on a different getting looked over.  He also said it wouldn't be ready to drive until 3pm. He was apologetic as well as professional about it.  That saved them from a 1 star review. Unfortunately they wasted my time and I ended up buying the same vehicle from a different lot the very next day.

Had they been honest with me about the vehicle upfront I may have waited a day before making the trip out there and very likely would have bought it right then and there. Hopefully they get their communication issues ironed out. If you do go out there for a specific car, make sure to talk with at leasr two different people on the phone to confirm the car you want isn't  unavailable.<//review>

< Time>
1555223115427<//Time>
<rate>1</rate>< review>
I feel like the reviews are sugar-coated and full of bliss, so I will enlighten to whoever is reading this. Everybody needs to remember that salesman will try to act nice and legit, when truly the opposite is in effect. About some time ago, I went to go run numbers on a vehicle from these guys , and of course what happened next was expected no less from a used-car dealership. These guys want you to use their "bank" and system of finance, by force. They will lie to you by saying that, "you need this program" or "it can't be done that way, you need to get our insurance". They told me all of this, and before i was about to walk away, the salesman dashes to his manager and brings him to me. This is were the fight begins. The manager had an Arabian accent so thick, that unfortunately i couldn't comprehend what he was saying; therefore, I told him, "what are you doing here? Cant your salesman handle this?" He then replied in a strange and rude manner to me, I told him that his salesman was lying about the financial dogma. I told that I've been buying cars from official dealerships my whole life and have experience in all the lies and "goodies" that salesman try to give. He then of course proceeded with his rude remarks, so I walked away. Of course he said stuff like, "You will get the same thing everywhere else". Fortunately, later that day I went to an official dealership and brought my own financing and deal, the salesman that helped us was more professional and kind than STG. Even later that day, I walked out with a brand new car that was summed by my own financing and deal, and of course the salesman tried to say no but we negotiated and met halfway. Overall, never go to a used car dealership, perhaps they only exist to help people who can't do the research for themselves or people that dont know any better.< /review>

1532760689336< /date>
<Rating>5<//Rating>< text>
What can I say, just excellent service! I inquired about a few cars being that I narrowed my choices down. Sam helped me throughout the process, Mark the manager assigned him to me. When I showed up for my test drive literally every person smiled and greeted me, EVERYONE. Working in sales at a specialty store, I know how hard it can be, and I also know that the little things really do go a long way.

Sam informed me right away that one of the vehicles were no longer avaoavail, and the entire time he was kind, funny, and my favorite part: COMPLETELY TRANSPARENT. He answered all questions honestly and to where I understood. He didn't hide anything either.

Once I got approved he went over all the paperwork piece by piece, and was so patient which I appreciated. I've walked out before from salespeople who didn't answer questions or seemed open to me asking. The manager was also helpful and made sure I was okay and knew my decisions. There was also no pressure on anything and they did listen when I said no to certain things.

I now have the car of my dreams, a 2017 Jeep Patriot and I couldn't be happier. Great customer service and experience from well trained people who are willing to help!< /text>

<text>We were charged $495 for window tint that came from the factory and they forced us to buy the optional GPS tracking system as well for $995. Sales guy, Albert, said all those were optional. I also told Albert that I wanted no gap insurance or any of their extended warranty. The finance guy, Rafael, said the tint and GPS tracking system was already installed on the car and can't be taken out so we MUST pay for it. On the invoice it says optional. Rafael, too lazy to remove gap insurance so he said we can just cancel it on our own when I caught the gap insurance on the invoice, he acted dumb like he thought I knew that it was included with the price. He even had the audacity to say the only reason we were getting the vehicle was because we were getting the gap insurance. I made him show me the "small print" showing that we can cancel it since he was too lazy to remove it. Don't let these guys fool you with those cheap prices, they will gouge you of your money. We should have just walked away from the deal. The only reason why we stuck with the deal was that the vehicle was such a great price and even with that additional scam charge of $1500 for those two optional items and the extra $895 for the "gap insurance/debt cancellation insurance", the vehicle was still cheaper than 99% of the market.

Be forewarned that all the optional items ARE in fact OPTIONAL. Walk away if they try to charge you those unless you're getting a great deal regardless of those extra charges. Don't let the finance people at STG fool you into thinking you MUST get it, you DO NOT. Learn from my mistake.

Minus 4-stars for Rafael being lazy and scamming people for their hard-earned cash. Don't know how these guys sleep soundly at night. 1-star for Albert for not being pushy and honest.</text>< Pictures>

This is going to be long, but I have to be detailed about this so you know just how ridiculous this place is.

The day I bought my vehicle from STG, I had planned just to give it a look and test drive it and then look at another car from a different dealership. I tried to leave many times, but they were good salesmen. They got the price down to what I felt like was a really good deal, so I agreed to buy the vehicle. It‚Äôs a 2016 Chevy Trax. Maybe this is where you might think I should have known better, but when I test drove the car I noticed the check engine like was on. I mentioned it to Michael Moreno, who was the salesman I dealt with and he assured me many many times that they do a 180-point inspection on all their cars and that the service guys probably just forgot to turn the check engine light off. I was slightly skeptical and so he told me he would schedule a service appointment for me and they would definitely take care of it if there were in fact any issues. He even put this in my contract when I signed all the paperwork to purchase the car.

Until I knew what was about to happen, my experience with Michael and all of the salesmen here was nice so when they asked me to leave a review for them, I had no problem doing so. I gave them 5 stars and complimented Michael for his help. WELL, on the way home from the dealership, my car stalled and black smoke started coming out of the engine. My brother is a mechanic and was able to scan the engine codes and it was clear that they did not do their claimed ‚Äú180 point inspection.‚Äù There were many issues with the engine and the car went into limp mode while I was driving it. I should mention that the reason I was even buying a new car is because I had just been in a car accident and my previous car was totaled. Having the car stall in the middle of a busy intersection and watching black smoke come from my engine was a little traumatic after having just been in an accident.

I immediately called Michael to let him know and he basically told me I had to figure out how to get the car back down there and that they wouldn‚Äôt be able to look at it until Monday (this is happening on a Saturday). After the couple days has passed, Andrew lets me know that they still don‚Äôt have the loaner car and it probably won‚Äôt be back until the following week. < review>
DON'T GO TO THIS PLACE! See Reviews on Yelp plz.
I'm a foreigner and I needed to buy a used car. I love Suv's cars and I found one at a very good price from this place at the end of August. Steve was my salesman, and he was not very welcoming (looked like I was boring him). I explained my situation to him (as a foreigner, I needed to wait for my money from my country). The price was $17K but he added GPS tracker and tinted glass and tried to add a kind of warranty extension for $4000 (!!!). He said that I had no choice for tinted glass and GPS tracker ($800)... after I asked, he said the tires were 80% new (I'm not a mecanician...). The final price was $20K, I said OK and I paid $500 as a deposit and signed the contract. I had to wait 10 days to receive my money from my country, and almost every day the salesman texted me and rushed me to get the money, whatever I explained, he just kept saying "I need money now". After that, I tried to apply for the Insurance but they needed a few business days for review. The salesman was very upset and asked to come with the money and take my car later (when I will have my insurance). Fortunately, my cousin told me not to do so and to wait for my insurance. Once I get it, I took an Uber for 2 hours to pick up my new car. When I left the dealership, the TPMS system alerted me for a tire issue... I stopped the car and I tried to reach my salesman but he was not available... Another salesman said: "This is totally normal, you need to drive a few miles and the TPMS system will be alright". I said: "Are you sure, because it's weird that I have this alert only for one tire", "Yes sure, ask if you have any problem". I drove 1 hour and when I arrived at home my dashboard displayed "TPMS system error, please repair".  I sent several text messages to STG Auto Group, no answer. I sent an email, they replied: "I will have your salesman reach out to service for you so we can get it looked at."... But I never get an answer, text or call. But it was not the only issue, here is an extract of another email I sent to them at the beginning of October: "Contrary to what you told me, my TPMS was broken and I had to fix it by another garage for $100.
The STG salesman told me my tires were 80% new when I asked, but eventually, it turned out the tires were 80% old... Thus, I had to replace them for $1000. When doing that, the garage found out that one of the tires had water inside, and that a screw of the back right tire was forced with an air gun, which damaged the whole screw system! Now I can only use 4 screws instead of 5. And I can't change only the screw because it's damaged inside the wheel...
Moreover, I'm still waiting for my number plate. Whereas the salesman told me the waiting time was about 15 days, it's been 41 days now, and still nothing. Can you tell me why?"

STILL NO ANSWER!
So, whatever the issue with your car, you will be alone. CUSTOMER SERVICE 0*!
Very bad first experience for a foreigner...<//review>

<text>Wow.. the customer experience here is as good as it gets. Alexis waited patiently for my late arrival. Was promptly outside to greet me when I arrived. < Review>
I went to several different dealerships within a span of one week and STG in Ontario was the absolute worst. I went in because I was interested in a (barely) used Equinox. Salesperson, William, was great and answered all of our questions. However, when we got to the financing portion of the deal, they were not upfront and were deceitful. I asked for a 72-month term and, although they met my desired monthly payment, they tried to sneak in an extra 12 months of payments. They held on to my ID and deposit so I could not just up and leave. They kept having different sales people talk to us even though we were very clear we wanted to leave. At the end, several hours later,  Mark offered incentives if we agreed to purchase the vehicle but it was too late. I would not make a deal with this dealership. It's now almost a week later and I have not received my deposit. I called the dealership and they said it takes 7-10 days, which was not disclosed before I left the dealership.</Review>

< userid>
107184605736098330890<//userid>
< username>
Sandy Shines</username>
< date>
1560528533672</date>
<Rating>1< /Rating>< Review>
Beware. First, make them show you your credit scores. They try to hide this when you have great credit, likely, so you do not fall for the sales pitch on this is the "best" We were approved for 0.9 financing from honda, same scores an STG offered 6.99. Above that, they try to get you to be hyper focused on the monthly payment versus the overall cost of the car. As some others have noted, you fill the app, the finance/sales person then enters, already including all these warranties and protections no one asked for. After possibly putting 20k down on a $34k car, the overall cost after 72 months of payments was going to be over $33k, lol, what a joke. After we explained continuously, the cost of the warranties had nothing to do with the monthly payment, that, we were focused on the overall cost, then, all of a sudden, they could "waive" "reduce" and "negotiate" the cost of GPS tracking? your insurance should cover a stolen vehicle. Appearance protection? Sure, we have been there with honda and it was a nightmare, not paying for this. Window tint. They said they just got the car on the lot, and tinted it too,? Sure. It is all fluff and stuff. Let me fluff with my words and stuff your paperwork with erroneous charges. You can buy gap insurance from your own insurance company- it is always less expensive than any dealer.  Ask the finance guy to leave the room, review your paperwork and really think about what you are buying and paying for. We loved, loved, loved the  SUV we planned to purchase, but, when it came time to the numbers, they were all wrong and we deaded the deal. They are your friends until you sign, then, you are on your own, this is with any dealership...So, rent a car for a month if you realllllly need a car and do the math, do your research and shop around. All dealerships play this ridiculous game of "how much advantage can we take of the vulnerable who do not know" and when you do know, you are not a friend...lol<//Review>

<rate>2<//rate>< review>
My review is based on my recent experience with salesman Adam. I scheduled an appointment days in advance for a test drive and was on time to the appointment but...Adam was just rolling in to the office and informed us that he‚Äôd had a late sale until 1AM that same morning. Maybe that extra bit of information was supposed to serve as an apology for the fact that he was clearly unprepared for our visit and he really couldn‚Äôt have cared. To make it simple, the car we had arranged on test driving was on a separate lot that we had to drive to and then without any gas to actually drive it... Well, that was all annoying but nothing in comparison to what was next. After agreeing to purchase the car and telling Adam I had my own financing with a Dealer Request Form to wire over the exact amount he flat out refused. He stated ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt accept that here‚Äù without really explaining anything at all. He made it as impossible as he could for me to purchase the car, making me finance through STG and THEN getting a check from my bank to be mailed to the dealership all the while saying ‚Äúthis is how we do it-it‚Äôs normal‚Äù. Days after the purchase I‚Äôm contacted by a different STG staff asking for the Dealer Request Form for my bank. Hm, that‚Äôs interesting...Turns out Adam lives up to the stereotypical used car salesman- dishonest, manipulative, and pushy. But thankfully, I‚Äôm financed through my bank and won‚Äôt ever be working with this Auto Group again! Lesson learned.</review>

<user_id>105391580290589426550< /user_id>< name>
Fred Garvin< /name>
< time>
1533585678751< /time>
<rating>1< /rating>< Review>
My wife and I came to STG Auto group based on a 2017 truck with low mileage offer for sale.
When we arrived at the Garden Grove location we found the truck to be filthy dirty inside with sweat stains in the seats, cigarette burns in the headliner and a huge section of paint missing inside the bed of the truck.  My wife had seen a 2018 used truck in the same add so when the salesman Kevin finally showed up for our appointment we found and test drove that truck instead. During the ‚Äúdeal ‚Äúwe told Kevin and Bill we wanted our registration in Arizona. Bill said that would be no problem but he ‚Äújust needed our California address to start the financing paperwork‚Äù.  Bill returned several time throughout the process and at one point reconfirmed that we would receive the Arizona plates for the truck. During the review of our contract we found an additional $495.00 added to the internet pricing. When I confronted Bill about the pricing he said their advertising says they can change the price of the sale based on accessories. Although this was just another indication how underhanded this dealer is, my wife and I wanted the truck and agreed to the additional monies.  Fast forward a month later California plates and registration arrived for this truck.
My wife called the salesman Kevin who did not return her call. When she finally got him on the phone he said he knew nothing about it and could not help. My wife then contacted Bill for resolution but she did not receive a call back. I contacted Bill to follow up on my wife‚Äôs questions and he said he had no recollection of her or the issue.  I reminded Bill of his commitment to register the vehicle and he denied the conversation ever happened, and then said ‚Äúit‚Äôs impossible to register a vehicle bought in one state in another‚Äù. If Bill had been truthful when we started the transaction, we would have gone back to Arizona and waited for the right truck there. Bill said he would work on a resolution but he never called back.
I placed several calls to Bills supervisor Mondo and explained the false and misleading statement of his staff .  Mondo said he would follow up and call back but he never did return any call.
I made several more calls to STG and spoke to the General Manager Mike at the Ontario location. Once again I explained the facts and added all the issues that have been building up, the fact that they place a dirty damaged vehicle for sale with no mention of the condition, the bait and switch markup of the internet advertised price,  the blatant lying on the registration, and the lack of follow up by his staff .
Mike said he would look into the situation and call me back.  Like everyone else in this unethical company Mike never called back. I called him 5 times in the course of two weeks and he was not available any of the times nor did he return any of my multiple voicemails.
It‚Äôs a shame that unscrupulous dealers like this will do and say anything to make the sale. My mistake was not researching registration for cars before talking to this bunch of thieves.   The $495 over payment is definitely my mistake to own since I ‚Äúwanted‚Äù the truck and had spent so much time in the dealership.  I still will point out the deceitful advertising that apparently says (in small print somewhere) that they can change the price. (They charged me for tinted windows although they did not tint them?)
At each level in this organization I found apathy and a lack of ethics. My surprise was to find this extends all the way to the top of this organization.  I would urge anyone thinking of purchasing a vehicle steer clear of STG Auto Group.</Review>

****STOP*****
***** DONT BUY A CAR FROM THEM****
I hate to write this review but after spending 90k on a Range Rover from STG and was told this car was almost new condition I feel like I have to tell the community about these guys and their bad unethical tactics.

We made a deal on the rover which I put down $10k to buy because their price was lower than EVERYONE else's which made me feel good and excited! But once I went into their finance guy to sign the paperwork they tried to add on everything from a GPS for $800 to a clear sealant for $1200 and many other extras. When I stood up from being body slammed, there was like $8k in add on options. My sales rep. Joseph Isaak tried hard to keep on everything, but I refused which they didn‚Äôt like so they had someone else try and push the products to me and I still declined. Finally, they offered me this Smartcare warranty a la cart which they promised me would cover any issues I have with my car. So, I accepted that signed the docs and moved on.

Fast Fwd to a year later the engine on the Range Rover goes out because apparently there‚Äôs a water coolant hose defect in the engine and cost over $20k to fix. I literally jumped out my seat when I heard that, but I wasn‚Äôt worried to much because I was told my Rover had a good solid warranty. When the Dealer went to file the warranty claim they were told that it‚Äôs a defective part in the engine that is not covered, and this is where all the bad service started to take place!

I called STG and no one would return my calls all of a sudden a great customer that‚Äôs part of their STG family was left in the streets to fend for himself which I believe is completely wrong and horrible business, because I was promised by them that I was covered if anything happens to my car. STG told me it‚Äôs not their problem it‚Äôs between me and the warranty company. I explained that you guys at STG sold defective car, with defective parts.  Which also means it‚Äôs a lemon.

They ignored my calls in after finally getting mad at them the owner Tony Bacily agreed to help me. So, I brought my car in on a tow truck and they said they were going to cover the problem or put me in another vehicle. After weeks in there shop the Owner tells me they couldn‚Äôt do anything and wanted me to pay out of pocket which I declined because I have a warranty from them and I shouldn‚Äôt have to pay. Now I have a Range Rover that I paid 90k for and in a year has a blown motor this company is shady and practices mob style tactics.

I have reason to believe that they have an interest in the premiums I paid for the warranty, and that‚Äôs why they don‚Äôt want to cover the repairs. I'm sure it will affect their bottom line. Since they are going to play games with me, I am going to all of their social media sites to let consumers like me know that you need to "Beware of this STG group" they lure you in with a low sales price and force sell you aftermarket products to make up for selling the car cheap. Then before you know it you will end up paying $8k in extras. Most likely you'll never need to use their products they are no good, and don‚Äôt cover you.

In Summary, I called the two owners (Tony & Ryan) and their managers multiple times and no one even wanted to call me back until I went down there. The owner Tony calls and says u know we don‚Äôt have to repair it, but what I can do is put you in another car which means they want me to take a huge loss and put up a new down payment which I refuse to do especially after seeing how they deal with customers and having already dropped a lot of down payment on my current one.

I have a lot more to say about these guys and there BS tactics but I will leave it for my lawyer to expose and if anyone is reading this and has a similar situation reach out to me and I‚Äôll direct you to my lawyer because after reviewing my situation he said they sold me a lemon and that they don‚Äôt want to be responsible for and leave me out to dry!

Someone call 911</review>

< review>
Phil Schmall & Michael Beshay were patient, kind, informative, and extremely helpful in getting me exactly what I wanted for the payment I could afford.  I had researched many dealers, and even went to a few before connecting with STG Group.  The amount that was quoted for the car I wanted, was the amount that was financed (including GAP insurance), and at a lower interest rate than the pre-qualified amount I had come in with. I am extremely impressed with both men, and STG in general.  They seem to be ethical, and truly concerned with trying to get their customers what they want, and/or can actually afford.  There was no high pressure sales pitch. I was in and out in a couple of hours (including vehicle inspection by me,  a test drive, and multiple questions). I would; and will recommend them to anyone who needs a new or used car. I was shopping for a newer used car, and got exactly what I was looking for.</review>
